<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 123, 637, 146]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 171, 195, 186]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 216, 247, 231]]<|/det|>
    

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 216, 424, 259]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 224, 169, 239]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 279, 231, 294]]<|/det|>
MATHEMATICS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 304, 311, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[762, 329, 905, 344]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 393, 372]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 393, 402]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|>
- Answer all questions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 467]]<|/det|>
- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 565, 497]]<|/det|>
- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 478, 512]]<|/det|>
- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 355, 528]]<|/det|>
- Do not write on any bar codes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 867, 545]]<|/det|>
- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|>
- You should use a calculator where appropriate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 591]]<|/det|>
- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 856, 620]]<|/det|>
- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|>
# INFORMATION

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 683, 388, 698]]<|/det|>
- The total mark for this paper is 75 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 715]]<|/det|>
- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 74, 565, 91]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 743, 107]]<|/det|>
1 Solve the equation \(\frac{\mathrm{e}^{x}+2 \mathrm{e}^{-x}}{\mathrm{e}^{x}-3}=4\) ．Give your answer correct to 3 decimal places．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 99]]<|/det|>
2 (a) Expand \((6-x)(1-2 x)^{-\frac{3}{2}}\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\), simplifying the coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 649, 623, 668]]<|/det|>
(b) State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion is valid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 918, 91]]<|/det|>
3 On an Argand diagram shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) which satisfy both the inequalities \(|z-3 \mathrm{i}| \leqslant 2\) and \(\frac{1}{4} \pi<\arg(z-1-2 \mathrm{i}) \leqslant \frac{3}{4} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 576, 93]]<|/det|>
4 Solve the equation \(3 \cot x-4 \cot 2 x=3\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 95]]<|/det|>
5 The square roots of \(-1-4 \sqrt{5} \mathrm{i}\) can be expressed in the Cartesian form \(x+\mathrm{i} y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 918, 141]]<|/det|>
By first forming a quartic equation in \(x\) or \(y\), find the square roots of \(-1-4 \sqrt{5} \mathrm{i}\) in exact Cartesian form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 637, 91]]<|/det|>
6 (a) By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 99, 567, 126]]<|/det|>
\[
|x-2|=2 \sin \frac{1}{2} x
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 136, 501, 152]]<|/det|>
has only one root in the interval \(0<x<\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 507, 603, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) Show by calculation that this root lies between 1 and 1.5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 918, 99]]<|/det|>
(c) Use the iterative formula \(x_{n+1}=2-2 \sin \frac{1}{2} x_{n}\) with an initial value of 1.03 to calculate the root correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 97]]<|/det|>
7 （a）Express \(7 \sin \theta+24 \cos \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta-\alpha)\) ，where \(R>0\) and \(0<\alpha<\frac{1}{2} \pi\) ．Give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 4 decimal places．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 686, 99]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence solve the equation \(7 \sin \frac{1}{3} x+24 \cos \frac{1}{3} x=24.5\) for \(0<x<\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 535, 91]]<|/det|>
8 The variables \(x\) and \(\theta\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 98, 606, 130]]<|/det|>
\[
\sin 2 \theta \frac{\mathrm{~d} x}{\mathrm{~d} \theta}=(4 x+3) \cos 2 \theta
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 133, 322, 156]]<|/det|>
and \(x=0\) when \(\theta=\frac{1}{12} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 168, 703, 184]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation and obtain an expression for \(x\) in terms of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 753, 91]]<|/det|>
9 With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A, B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[258, 99, 741, 157]]<|/det|>
\[
\overrightarrow{O A}=\left(\begin{array}{c}
1 \\
-4 \\
2
\end{array}\right), \quad \overrightarrow{O B}=\left(\begin{array}{c}
-2 \\
1 \\
3
\end{array}\right) \quad \text { and } \quad \overrightarrow{O C}=\left(\begin{array}{c}
2 \\
3 \\
5
\end{array}\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 168, 559, 184]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a vector equation for the line through \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 505, 592, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) Using a scalar product, find the exact value of \(\cos B A C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 487, 91]]<|/det|>
（c）Hence find the exact area of triangle \(A B C\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 650, 97]]<|/det|>
10 (a) Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{2}\) is divided by \(1+4 x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 659, 482, 692]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{0.5} x \tan ^{-1}(2 x) \mathrm{d} x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 105, 90]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[365, 92, 631, 272]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 287, 846, 307]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=5 \sin 2 x \cos ^{2} x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \pi\) and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 321, 421, 337]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
(b) By using the substitution \(u=\cos x\), find the area of the region bounded by the curve, the \(x\)-axis between \(x=0\) and \(x=\frac{1}{4} \pi\), and the line \(x=\frac{1}{4} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 565, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
